artist: Artist: David Rathman; Author: Kenneth Patchen; Publisher: Vermillion Editions Limited, Minneapolis; Designer: Portfolio case co-designed by Steven M. Andersen; Designer: Portfolio case co-designed by David Rathman
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description: Color lithographs with screenprinting on Rives BFK paper; housed in a hinged plywood portfolio box with title branded on front cover; artist's book. Designed by Steven Andersen and David Rathman.

medium: Color lithographs with screenprinting; loose in portfolio
provenance: Vermillion Editions Limited, Minneapolis (publisher); sold to MIA, 1992.
text: David Rathman's provocative artist's book is based on Kenneth Patchen's celebrated experimental novel The Journal of Albion Moonlight (1941), a chronicle of humanity's moral failure. An uncompromising pacifist, Patchen wrote the unorthodox, stream-of-consciousness "vision-poem" during the early years of the Second World War (1939-45). In the 1960s, the novel became a symbol of protest among students and anti-war activists.  Rathman renews the bold warnings of Albion Moonlight through a series of graphic lithographs that echo the novel's passionate anti-war sentiment.
title: The Enchanted Assassin
